instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01700 5v 0.3a  PPBUS 5v
threads.message:
no water damage, no AWAKE no SLPS2R voltage , no short found.. no ssd voltage and not short.
replaced u7000 but the same..all 4 LDOs look o.k

threads.title: 820-01700 5v 0.3a  PPBUS 5v
threads.message: Remove F7000/1 and check C7050 voltage.

threads.title: 820-01700 5v 0.3a  PPBUS 5v
threads.message:
So your problem is not in U7000 area.
Thinks more next time, before changing it.

Resolder f7000/1.
Post exact diode mode at PPBUS_G3H; check it in both directions to ground.

threads.title: 820-01700 5v 0.3a  PPBUS 5v
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 101863, member: 682"]
both directions to ground
[/QUOTE]

 293 diode mode

threads.title: 820-01700 5v 0.3a  PPBUS 5v
threads.message:
You should get higher reading in reverse way.
Check if any big coil gives you same actual readings.

threads.title: 820-01700 5v 0.3a  PPBUS 5v
threads.message: just the PPBUS and PPVBAT_G3H big coils gave this reading 293/5

threads.title: 820-01700 5v 0.3a  PPBUS 5v
threads.message: Check the resistance between these lines, in ohm scale.

threads.title: 820-01700 5v 0.3a  PPBUS 5v
threads.message: can i do it on F7000?

threads.title: 820-01700 5v 0.3a  PPBUS 5v
threads.message: if yes so its 0.11 same as good board

threads.title: 820-01700 5v 0.3a  PPBUS 5v
threads.message: im sorry its 2.0-1.5OHM but no stable.. but look like the same as good board
